1.name: Raul Portales
1.title: Android Developer
1.shortBio: Raul Portales is a Software Engineer working on mobile since the early times.
1.bio: Raul Portales is a Software Engineer working on mobile since the early times. He switched from Symbian to Android in 2009 (before Android versions had tasty names) and never looked back. He loves public speaking and has presented at several DroidCons, Game Developer Conferences and many GDGs. After working a lot on the front end - especially building games - Raul has developed a special interest in UX and UI.

2.name: Ben Weiss
2.title: Android Engineer
2.shortBio: Ben is a Developer Programs Engineer at the Android Developer Relations team at Google.
2.bio:
Ben is a Developer Programs Engineer at the Android Developer Relations team at Google.
He’s been working with Android since the first public release.
Recently his focus was on Animations, Transitions, Android Instant Apps and Kotlin.

4.name: Bruce Mcpherson
4.title: Consultant
4.shortBio: Bruce is a veteran IT practioner, with 30+ years as CIO, Chief Architect and many other roles – mainly in large global enterprises.
4.bio: Bruce is a veteran IT practioner, with 30+ years as CIO, Chief Architect and many other roles – mainly in large global enterprises. With expertise in each of Google, Microsoft and Oracle technologies his main interest is in integration, and has published several O'Reilly video courses and Books on Google Apps Script and JavaScript. Bruce is a Google Developer Expert (GDE) for Apps Script and Identity.

badges.name: GDE
badges.description: Google Developer Expert for Apps Script and Identity

5.name: Mark Masterson
5.title: Global Program Manager, Google Launchpad
5.shortBio: I work for Google, where I currently help lead one of their startup programs, Google Developers Launchpad.
5.bio: I work for Google, where I currently help lead one of their startup programs, Google Developers Launchpad. Prior to Google, I failed miserably as a startup CTO, and prior to that, spent many years in the mines of the financial services industry, being punished for my sins. I like Frisbee and dislike speaker bios.

6.name: Rachel Andrew
6.title: Invited Expert to the CSS WG
6.shortBio: Rachel Andrew is a front and back-end web developer, author and speaker.
6.bio: Rachel Andrew is a front and back-end web developer, author and speaker. Author or co-author of 22 books including The New CSS Layout, published in October 2017 by A Book Apart. Rachel is co-founder of the CMS Perch, a Google Developer Expert and an Invited Expert to the CSS Working Group.

7.name: Mathias Bynens
7.title: JavaScript whisperer
7.shortBio: Mathias is a web standards enthusiast with a passion for HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Unicode, performance, and security.
7.bio: Mathias is a web standards enthusiast with a passion for HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Unicode, performance, and security.

8.name: Juarez Filho
8.title: Google Developer Expert
8.shortBio: Passionate about traveling and also to share his adventures with Web Technologies and Firebase
8.bio: Passionate about traveling and also to share his adventures with Web Technologies and Firebase. As a Google Developer Expert, he’s helping communities all over the world to learn, discover and have fun.

badges.name: GDE
badges.description: Google Developer Expert for Web Technologies

9.name: Martin Hawksey
9.title: GDE Google Apps Script
9.shortBio: Martin Hawksey has held advisory roles within the UK EdTech sector and is currently Chief Innovation, Community and Technology Officer at the Association for Learning Technology (ALT)
9.bio: Martin Hawksey has held advisory roles within the UK EdTech sector and is currently Chief Innovation, Community and Technology Officer at the Association for Learning Technology (ALT). In these roles Martin has supported the exploration and adoption of innovative approaches to technology enhanced learning. Martin writes extensively on Google Apps Script, a programming tool integrated into Google Drive, and is a member of Google Developer Experts community.

badges.name: GDE
badges.description: Google Developer Expert for Google Apps Script

10.name: Marc Paulina
10.title: User Experience Designer
10.shortBio: Marc is a senior designer at Google, focusing on user experience design for the Google Assistant.
10.bio: Marc is a senior designer at Google, focusing on user experience design for the Google Assistant. Marc is interested in blending the superpowers of the social sciences, deep listening and design thinking to inspire human-centered experiences that will be the standard of user experience in the future of smart, ambient assistive computing.

11.name: James Munnelly
11.title: Kubernetes Solutions Engineer
11.shortBio: I'm a Solutions Engineer at Jetstack, a Kubernetes focused consultancy. This involves helping customers bend and break Kubernetes to their will, and training their teams to make best use of it.
11.bio: I'm a Solutions Engineer at Jetstack, a Kubernetes focused consultancy. This involves helping customers bend and break Kubernetes to their will, and training their teams to make best use of it. I've written a number of extensions for Kubernetes, and work on the core codebase in order to make it easier for others to do the same.

12.name: Javier Ramirez
12.title: Cloud Engineer
12.shortBio: Cloud and big data engineer with a past in software development. Co-founder of teowaki, a consultancy company specialized in GCP.
12.bio: Cloud and big data engineer with a past in software development. Co-founder of teowaki, a consultancy company specialized in GCP. I've been a Google Developer Expert in Cloud for over 4 years and a GCP trainer for over 2.

13.name: Sebastian Benz
13.title: Developer Advocate
13.shortBio: Sebastian works with developers around the world helping them build great experiences for web and Android. He created and maintains ampbyexample.com.
13.bio: Sebastian works with developers around the world helping them build great experiences for web and Android. He created and maintains ampbyexample.com.

14.name: Emma Guy
14.title: Android Engineer
14.shortBio: Emma is currently an Android Engineer at Monzo, building a better bank. Prior to this, she was at couple of app agencies, creating a number of different apps for a wide variety of clients
14.bio: Emma is currently an Android Engineer at Monzo, building a better bank. Prior to this, she was at couple of app agencies, creating a number of different apps for a wide variety of clients. She began her career writing enterprise software at a couple of different companies before tinkering enough with Android in her free time to know she wanted to pursue it full time.

15.name: Luba Elliott
15.title: Creative AI Researcher
15.shortBio: Luba Elliott is a curator, artist and researcher looking at artificial intelligence in the creative industries.
15.bio: Luba Elliott is a curator, artist and researcher looking at artificial intelligence in the creative industries. She is currently working to educate and engage the broader public about the latest developments in creative AI through monthly meetups, talks and tech demonstrations. Prior to that, she worked in venture capital and art startups.

16.name: Gen Ashley
16.shortBio: Gen is the Director of Women Who Code London, a Lead for Google Women Techmakers London, NASA Space Apps Challenge London and Twitter Developer Community London. She is also part of the leadership committee for Ada's List.
16.bio: Gen is the Director of Women Who Code London and is a very active leader in the Tech community in London. Aside from her involvement with Women Who Code she is a Lead for Google Women Techmakers London, NASA Space Apps Challenge London and Twitter Developer Community London. She is also part of the leadership committee for Ada's List (a network for women in technology). She is co-organiser of COED:CODE, OpenTechSchool London and London Game Developers. She was the Head of Developer Outreach at Skills Matter and a former VP / Business Development Manager / Project Manager at Citigroup. In 2016 Gen helped lead Anita Borg Institute London and was actively instrumental in delivering the very first 1-Day Grace Hopper Conference in Europe which was held in London.

17.name: Swav Kulinski
17.title: Lead Android Developer
17.shortBio: Coding since 1986, currently Android evangelist, leading a Droid team at The App Business. Swav's interest is around evolution of technology, spotting early distruptors and finding ways how to adopt them.
17.bio: Coding since 1986, currently Android evangelist, leading a Droid team at The App Business. Swav's interest is around evolution of technology, spotting early distruptors and finding ways how to adopt them.

18.name: Giovanni Vacanti
18.title: Physicist, Data Scientist
18.shortBio: After obtaining a master degree in physics at University of Palermo, Italy, Giovanni joined the graduate program at Centre for quantum technologies, National University of Singapore, where he obtained a Phd in Theoretical physics in 2013.
18.bio: After obtaining a master degree in physics at University of Palermo, Italy, Giovanni joined the graduate program at Centre for quantum technologies, National University of Singapore, where he obtained a Phd in Theoretical physics in 2013. Until 2015, he worked as a postdoctoral researcher in theoretical quantum physics at Institut Neel, Grenoble, France. Since 2016 he works as a Data scientist at Seldon technologies , developing  machine learning solutions for various use cases.

19.name: Alessia Sannazzaro
19.title: Entrepreneur
19.shortBio: Alessia is the co-founder of Code & Wander, a digital product studio with a travelling twist.
19.bio: Alessia is the co-founder of Code & Wander, a digital product studio with a travelling twist. After graduating in Design and Innovation, Alessia entered the startup scene and gained recognition for her success in the NACUE Varsity Pitch, Get In The Ring and the London Entrepreneurs Challenge. Since then she’s worked in digital agencies collaborating with top brands to create internal and external products and strategies.

20.name: Aygul Zagidullina
20.title: Google Launchpad Mentor
20.shortBio: Aygul is an experienced community manager and advocate for women in tech. Ex-Googler. PhD in quantum chemistry.
20.bio: Aygul is an experienced community manager and advocate for women in tech. Ex-Googler. PhD in quantum chemistry. Enthusiastic serial volunteer who is involved in many innovative projects (Google Launchpad Mentor for marketing/ growth, Google Developer Group and Women Techmakers Lead for London, Google Top Contributor, a distinguished international speaker). Early adopter. Technology admirer. Named as one of The NEXT 100 Top Influencers of the European Digital Industry in 2013.

21.name: Alessandro Cinelli
21.title: Tech Lead
21.shortBio: Alessandro Cinelli (a.k.a. cirpo) is currently working in London as Lead/Tech Coach at AND Digital. He loves playing with programming languages and giving back to the community.
21.bio: Alessandro Cinelli (a.k.a. cirpo) is currently working in London as Lead/Tech Coach at AND Digital. He loves playing with programming languages and giving back to the community. When he was in Italy he has been a board member of the Italian PHP, Javascript User Group and WEBdeBS, co-organizing several events such as agileday, phpDay, jsDay, nosqlday and Nodejsconf. These days he is busy co-organizing tech events with @WEBdeLDN in London.

22.name: Mark Allison
22.title: Android Developer
22.shortBio: Mark Allison is a GDE for Android and software engineer with over 30 years’ experience. He is passionate about providing the user with the best possible experience.
22.bio:
Mark Allison is a GDE for Android and software engineer with over 30 years’ experience. He is passionate about providing the user with the best possible experience. He has developed both server and client side, most commonly Android on the client side, but with also for iOS, HTML5, Symbian, and J2ME. Mark writes a technical blog (http://blog.stylingandroid.com) which focuses on Android UI/UX topics, but often covers more general Android development techniques.

When not being geeky, Mark likes to unwind by hurling abuse at football referees, specifically those who are unkind to his beloved Watford FC with whom he holds a season ticket. He also has a deep love of spicy food, beer, and malt whisky; and consumes these at every opportunity!

Mark is happily married with a grown up step-daughter, and lives in Hertfordshire, UK.

23.name: John Spindler
23.title: CEO & Co-Founder
23.shortBio: CEO of Capital Enterprise, Co-Founder of the London Co-Investment Fund and founder and partner on the AI Seed Fund, John has fair claim to be the most active seed stage investor in the UK.
23.bio: CEO of Capital Enterprise, Co-Founder of the London Co-Investment Fund and founder and partner on the AI Seed Fund, John has fair claim to be the most active seed stage investor in the UK.

24.name: Marc Cohen
24.title: Developer Advocate
24.shortBio: Marc builds tools, demos, codelabs, and other things to make the Google Cloud Platform easier and more fun to use. Originally from New Jersey, then Seattle, he now lives and works in London.
24.bio: Marc builds tools, demos, codelabs, and other things to make the Google Cloud Platform easier and more fun to use. Originally from New Jersey, then Seattle, he now lives and works in London. He has co-authored a book about Google Compute Engine and wrote the product announcement demo. In a previous life, he developed communication systems at Bell Labs and Lucent Technologies. Outside of work, he enjoys indie music, quirky films (especially documentaries), books, puzzles, and chess. He's also very interested in education, teaching, and applying technology (like spaced repetition) to enhance the learning experience.

25.name: Daniel Rowles
25.title: CEO & Lead Trainer
25.company: Target Internet - The Digital Marketing Podcast
25.shortBio: Daniel has been working in digital marketing for the past 19 years, with extensive experience working both client-side and within the agency environment.
25.bio: Daniel has been working in digital marketing for the past 19 years, with extensive experience working both client-side and within the agency environment. He is a Course Director for the Chartered Institute for Marketing, an award-winning author, and lecturer at Imperial College and Cranfield School of Management.

26.name: Ciaran Rogers
26.title: Marketing Director
26.company: Target Internet - The Digital Marketing Podcast
26.shortBio: Ciaran is an experienced digital strategist with over 19 years experience, he has worked for and trained a large number of international brands including, and was a lead lecturer for Middlesex University on their Digital Marketing MA programme.
26.bio: Ciaran is an experienced digital strategist with over 19 years experience, he has worked for and trained a large number of international brands including, and was a lead lecturer for Middlesex University on their Digital Marketing MA programme.
